name: Luxury Bahia Principe Ambar Don Pablo Collection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Ambar for 2 weeks September 12.
reviews.title: A British opinion from a 30 something couple!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Check in was excellent, we were brought over from the Bavaro with our luggage, welcomed with a cocktail and given our keys and a map straight away. The bellboy took our luggage to our room.
reviews.title: Amazing Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE ROOM - We had a corner room on the 3rd floor, with a seaview. Villa 67. The rooms was huge, spotlessly clean and cool. It was my husbands birthday the day we arrived, they left him a letter wishing him happy birthday,a fruit bowl, a bottle of rum and 2 t-shirts, which really was a lovely touch. The bed was the biggest i had ever seen, 4 pillows wide!
reviews.title: Pleasant suprise in the Dom Rep

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cable TV has loads of chanels,but is tricky to work out how to use it.
reviews.title: overall nice place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: THE BEACH - Is very wide with loads of beds, try to get beds right by the sea, as you catch the breeze. The groundsmen work tirelessly to clean up the seaweed all day, my only gripe with the beach is the JCB that runs up and down carrying bags of removed seaweed and the lowflying helicopters that wake you up if you like a nap on the beach.The sea can get quite choppy, however it is fun watching people get KO'd by the waves when they try to get out!
reviews.title: superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed from November 7-14. We were in Building 68 on the 3rd floor. This was a 2 minutes walk to the beach/pool or the lobby, perfect location. Everyone was friendly and very helpful aside from a couple of bartenders on the water side of the swim up pool bar and the cleaning service. We didn't get any special treatment, never received turndown service, folded fancy towels or any extras like some in our group did, even after a generous tip. Maurice provided great customer service and made us feel welcome and always had a smile on her face. Elvis at the pool bar was amazing. And we LOVED Henry AKA "Megatron" (he takes pictures and they are amazing). The Santa Fe was the best meal that we had, the Steakhouse was good as well. The BBQ Buffet was our least favorite. Also note, I ordered a steak at every a la carte restaurant and no matter how it was ordered, it was always well done. Everyone in our party (there were 17 of us) would order them done differently and everyone's looked the same. And the cuts were always just a cheap steak whether it said filet mignon, ribeye, sirloin. Also, we asked ahead of time if premium drinks would be provided (specifically asked about Captain Morgan and were told it was available, but it was not). These however were just minor things in the big picture. I would highly recommend the Saona Island day trip as well. The Caribbean Sea is gorgeous. We would definitely recommend this to any friends and would love to return someday.
reviews.title: Excellent Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort was AWESOME!!! The service was EXCELLENT. The hotel accommodation was superb the rooms were very large and clean we stayed in Villa 67 which was minutes from the pool and beach. Our Butler Emmanuel made she we had reservations at each fine dining restaurant for each night he was very helpful making sure our refrigerator was refilled with beverages. For our Anniversary he surprised us with a bottle of Champaign and Roses and had the Jacuzzi tub decorated really nice once we returned from dinner. Amber Resort really knows how to take care of their guest. I will definitely return there next year for sure!!
reviews.title: Outstanding Vacation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Shun M.
reviews.title: Perfect Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The overall Bahia Principe property is huge, but the Ambar is a great size with everything easily accessible. We stayed in Villa 69, on the ground floor, a 2 minute walk one way to the pool & beach, and a 2 minute walk in the opposite direction to the main buffet & lobby. The room was a great size, always clean and well stocked with towels & bottled water, etc. The food at the main buffet, and the buffet/snack bar by the pool, was always good with lots of variety, from salads to desserts....oh the desserts! :) Service at the buffets was good too, finding us a table, getting a drink, taking away plates. Never a problem getting a drink at the pool bar, beach bar, or lobby bar...the chinola (passion fruit) daquiri was amazing. We ate at Don Pablo one night, the restaurant & service were great, the food was ok, we preferred the buffet. Found chairs at the pool & beach every day without too much trouble. The water in the pool & in the ocean was warm, ocean was a bit wavy, never got tossed around too much. The beach was clean, the sand was never hot to walk on and very soft. Getting up to the main resort the Bavaro, where the theater was located & most excursions leave from, was easy a shuttle is by every few minutes.
reviews.title: Diane W

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Spending time up in the bigger resorts, the Bavaro & Punta Cana, made me glad we were staying at the Ambar, it was cleaner, quieter, and much closer to the beach. We saw a bit of a couple of shows at the theater, and went to Pueblo Principe one night to listen to the band. The casino there is small, but I made a few bucks on the slots, so that was fun. Never went to the disco, too much sunshine & fresh air every day to stay up that late.
reviews.title: Good Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is our 20th All-Inclusive and our 6th in Punta Cana. Ambar's pluses far out weigh their minuses, but the minuses could so easily be fixed.
reviews.title: Best food in Punta Cana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Resort and Rooms are Beautiful. The staff is outstanding and the Service is outstanding. We had Lobster pretty much when we wanted it, but we found the RibEye and Filet's to be better and of high USA Quality. The Buffet is tight in space but run like clockwork. The Don Pablo Restaurant on site is unbelievable with a Carver that comes to your table to deliver your steak. The pool is outstanding and yes you have to get up early to get the prime pool real estate. The Beach area is one of the Best in Punta Cana and this is saying alot. The RIU is next door and it is clear where the Bahia beach ends and the RIU beach starts. Bahia is very particular that their beaches are clean for their customers. We thank you for this!!!
reviews.title: Wonderful relaxing vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel seemed full when we arrived on May 19th. We were immediately hit with Bahia Premier Club people. We had not checked in yet. This to us is OK. However, we were hit every day and sometimes multiple times a day. Please stop this. Please!!!
reviews.title: You will not be disappointed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We do not expect entertainment at the Pool. At Ambar there was no pool entertainment. We were at Excellence Club and found this to be very nice. For a fully booked hotel the evening entertainment was well below par. One night they had a great guitar guy and then they turned it into bad disco night. HEY, we would like to dance with our women close without sweating. Sometimes the entertainment stopped at 10:30 and sometimes at 11:00. This is OK as all resorts seem to be similar. The best singers were the guests who took stage when they asked.
reviews.title: very good with pros and cons

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beach, Quiet, Room, Food, and Staff far outweighed the Premier Club and bad entertainment. We do recommend and hope the entertainment was just bad timing.
reviews.title: what a holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Bahia Principe Ambar December 14th for one week. We enjoyed this resort so much that we returned 2 months later for another week stay on February 12th. Each time we had a fantastic holiday. This was our fifth time at the Bahia Principe Punta Cana and the Ambar.
reviews.title: 2 trips in 2 months, loved the Ambar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We flew with Air Canada in December and Air Transat in February. We were dropped at the Bavaro lobby and the bell boy took us to the Ambar lobby to check in.
reviews.title: Great resort not quite 5 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the February trip, we arrived and were advised by the reception that the Ambar was overbooked. We were put up in villa #71 in the Bavaro section for one night, given $100 cash then moved to the Ambar next morning. This wasn’t a big deal as we arrived at 8pm, ate dinner, sat in the lobby with friends and went to bed. Got up the next morning and moved to villa 67 in the Ambar.
reviews.title: Fun in the sun!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our rooms was perfect, third floor with an actual view of the ocean. The rooms were spacious and very clean. We don’t drink alcohol but did drink pop and water from the fridge which was stocked daily. The A/C worked well. The maid did a good job keeping the rooms clean. Don’t forget to leave a tip for the maid that does the nightly turn down service. These ladies rarely get a tip.
reviews.title: Excedllent hotel! Loved our stay at the Ambar!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was excellent. My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed the food. The buffet always had a good variety of food and we always found the food to be hot. The snack bar beside the Ambar pool could do with a bit more of a selection but was still good. We ate at 4 a-la-cartes. The Don Pablo gourmet in the Ambar section was fantastic. We also ate at the Mexican, Italian and Japanese. I booked our a-la-cartes in advance on both trips via email. I did this for us and also for some family and friends. Make sure you print off a copy of you requests with confirmation numbers and take it with you in case they have not printed of the dinner reservation tickets.
reviews.title: Overbooking common with this hotel chain

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were at the Ambar from Feb 8 to 15/08 and had a wonderful vacation. First I want to say is to make the best out of your vacation by having fun and relaxing. Enjoy the lovely resort and the great Caribbean weather. Its better than snow!!
reviews.title: Wonderful vacation

likes.disliked: — lack of policy of putting towels on chairs early in the morning and not using them for hours after

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: We were very fortunate to have villa 67 third floor over looking the pool and the ocean. However, with as many vacationers that are staying there not everyone can have the great views. We were not in our room that much, just to sleep, shower and dress, so actually the view really isnt that important. All rooms from what I heard are very nice. We did not have any difficulties with anything.
reviews.title: Total relaxation!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Except departing at the Punta Cana airport---they weighed our carry-ons with our check-in luggage (which they didnt do when we left the London,Ont airport)--we were 10 kilos over weight and had to pay $100.00 and this was not debatable. Then in the airplane I overheard another traveller say they didnt weigh her carry ons....so I guess it was just bad luck that they decided to weigh ours. Be sure to stay under your weight allowance to avoid having to pay.
reviews.title: Vacation of many new experiences

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pack light. The rooms have a great blow dryer-plenty of power so you dont have to pack yours. Also provided is an iron and ironing board, terry house coat and slippers.
reviews.title: Terrible Service for a 5 stars

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I over packed, didnt wear half the clothes I had brought. All you really need is plenty of bathing suits with cover ups to go to the breakfast/lunch buffets and evening wear to go to dinner, have cocktails in the lobby or go to the disco and the casino. (I actually won $350.00 on a nickle slot machine!!!)
reviews.title: the best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A beautiful resort but the service needs improvement.
reviews.title: It’s definitively not a 5 stars hotel.
Great vacation!
reviews.text: The bottom line: The place is beautiful especially the beach. The rooms are very comfortable and have a nice bathroom. The restaurants and the buffet are good but not exceptional. But the place is big, too big! You have to take a shuttle to go to the theatre.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In this kind of resort you are a number not a client and the service is not as high as it should be for a 5 stars hotel.
reviews.title: Highly recommend the Ambar!

likes.liked: — Quiet clean beautiful and not packed with people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The express service:
reviews.title: Great Time...Solo Adultos

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at 10h30 pm, no reception (too late I suppose), only one person for the checking and we just received our keys with no explanation. At this time all the restaurants and the snacks are closed. But you have the “express” service, in theory. Once in our room, we check for a menu, no menu, so we phoned to the “Express” service around 11h pm. At midnight we called back just in case they have forgotten us. “That won’t be long” was the answer, but at 1h am we gave up and went to sleep with a diet.
reviews.title: Great Vacation - But some let downs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I am a repeat guest at the Ambar. My previous stay was November 2011, and I this last visit was for two weeks ending November 15th 2013. Had this past visit been my first time at the Ambar it would have been my last.
reviews.title: Bahia Principe - Ambar...OMG What Happened?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Upon arrival I had to fight for a room close to ocean.. even though there were vacancies. They put me in the building furthest away.
reviews.title: Fun week at budget 5* Luxury Bahia Ambar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The ala carte restaurants are closed on a rotation basis, even though by day three of my stay the resort was at full capacity. When dining... remember to book all your ala cartes upon arrival...the restaurants are not even half full no matter what time you decide to dine.
reviews.title: wedding anniversary getaway-35 years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service at the pool bar was based upon the amount you tipped the servers. (It was a standing joke around the pool and I did lodge a formal complaint) They were frequently out of white wine..I mean really this is not five star. Only when the Ambar was full did you have seat service.
reviews.title: Great holiday!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Gosh help you if you wish to watch english tv to fall asleep by. You have to request the separate english converter and hope they can locate one.
reviews.title: Highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiancee and I stayed at the GBP Ambar from March 6-13. We have traveled to a good number of resorts throughout the Caribbean. This is the best resort we have stayed at, all resorts being a 4.5 star or higher.
reviews.title: A very good resort: what is good and what needs improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, this is a very good resort and can become excellent with a few touch-ups. This resort can be fun for either groups of friends or couples. I would advise guests to take the time to learn a few key phrases in Spanish to order drinks, meals, etc. I did this and it took me a few days of prep to learn this. Not hard at all.
reviews.title: UNREAL RESORT!!! DONT LISTEN TO THE HATERS ON THIS SITE!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: THE GREAT
reviews.title: The Ambar is not what it was 2 years ago

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Resort management and the ability to pre-book restaurants
reviews.title: Beautiful Beach, immaculate grounds, mediocre food, overall good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Overall quality of service of staff (with a few minor exceptions, particularly at buffet)
reviews.title: Beautiful resort, friendly staff, food mediocre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This was our eighth trip to the Ambar. We went with friends for the week of Oct. 21st to the 28th.
reviews.title: The good, bad and ugly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013
reviews.text: After 5 trips you are given a different color wrist band which you must ask for because they forget.
reviews.title: Not really a five star.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The GOOD- A walkway was installed on the beach which leads right to the beach bar.
reviews.title: Fantastic Vacation!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013
reviews.text: A nicety that was added was Franklin on the beach who swept the sand from our beach chairs.
reviews.title: Luxury is an overstatement.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally, we were allowed to swim in the pool after dark ( only one night) because they have a pool party for guest.
reviews.title: Quick tips to help, but would not recommend or return. Overall bad service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Looking for a Beautiful place to just RELAX...this is it! The ambar is an ADULT ONLY resort. it is quiet. If you are looking for a party this is not the place for you. The staff is EXCEPTIONAL! I went in June with my husband and did not expect what I found. It is clean, comfortable and well maintained by staff. The beach is beautiful and not loud . I was so taken by the place that I went back in July and now have made reservation to return this October for my husband's birthday. If you want nightly entertainment, you just hop on the golf cart and taken to the Bavaro or a 5-6 min walk. If anyone is looking for a place to just unwind, relax and forget about your daily routine..... I recommend this place to you.
reviews.title: The Place for RELAXATION !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are comfortable, there is a pillow menu for your sleep comforfort. ( i would recommend the lavender or camomille pillow)
reviews.title: Another fantastic GBP vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food: there are quite a few restaurants to choose from and are not limited to buffet. All restaurants are a la carte with the exception of the buffet. Plenty of variation!
reviews.title: FABULOUS!!!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff: I cannot say more than EXCEPTIONAL! You are treated like gold.
reviews.title: Ambar- Relax, Relate, and Release

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Flight: Uneventful direct Westjet flight from Toronto. Everything on-time and no lost or damaged luggage.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently returned from a one week vacation to Punta Cana, staying the first 3 nights at Gran Bahia Principe Ambar and the last 4 nights at Iberostar Grand Bavaro.
reviews.title: VERY PLEASANTLY SURPRISED...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While both resorts are adult only and all-inclusive, they are quite different and we enjoyed both of them.
reviews.title: Love the Ambar - especially the STAFF members!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Gran Bahia Principe Amba Resort, while located in the middle of the huge Bahia Principe complex, had the feel of a smaller resort with the option to "explore" the facilities at the others. Butler service available and choice of 4 restaurants and 3 bars. The room was nicely furnished with a partial ocean view in building 64 with all the amentities and everything in working order. We had no difficulty getting reservations at any of the restaurants and the food and service was excellent with a very friendly staff. The room and grounds were immaculate and they were contiuously maintaining all aspects of the property. The free wi-fi in the lobby worked well and offered a very pleasant atmosphere. We also ate at the Italian Restaurant at the Esmerelda and it far exceeded out expectations. The lunch buffet was good with a variety of choices. We are picky about alcohol and the included wines were good (not great) and they served premium vodka and scotch.
reviews.title: Absolute paradise, can't wait to go back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Because of the incredibly reasonable price, we did have low expectations but were extremely surprised and would definitely recommend and return to this resort. The only negative was the continous and unrelenting sales pitch from the Time Share peiple. Just saying "no" didn't work!
reviews.title: best vacation ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: We (an adult couple in our 50's) enjoyed the Ambar once again this year from 9-1 to 9-10-12. This was our 8th visit to a Gran Bahia all-inclusive resort (3rd time in the D.R.) and hope to return to the Ambar again & again. Every staff member that we met during our 10 days was great! (And we were blessed with absolutely perfect weather every day.)
reviews.title: The excellente Gran Bahia Principe Ambar!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was let down by the promising reviews I read before visiting this hotel, and feel that a different perspective is needed for travelers contemplating this hotel in the future. I do 3-4 trips a year, about 13 in the Caribbean in the last 4 years, including Mayan Riviera, Roatan, Cozumel, Cuba, and Jamaica. I have re-visited hotels in Roatan and Cozumel that I felt deserved my repeat business. I am not a difficult traveler. But I will not be revisiting the Ambar or any other Bahia Principe.
reviews.title: Deceived by previous reviews and 5 star rating

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The biggest issue I have with this resort is marketing itself as a 5 star. Anyone can claim to be 5 star, but the truth is in the delivery. For all those of you who have experienced a true 5 star and are contemplating this resort please take note – this is not a 5 star! For all those of who promoted and placed reviews on trip advisor that this was the best resort, a truly 5 start experience, you need to travel a little more before making such a claim.
reviews.title: Not too crazy about it......

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010
reviews.text: A 5 star does not allow people into a la carte restaurants in shorts and tank tops. A true 5 star does not make you wait a precious hour of your vacation to negotiate a la carte reservations. A true 5 start does not have buffets in the a la carte with the same food as the regular buffet restaurant. A true 5 start has decent cocktails in the lobby bar, things like clamato juice for Caesars, real fruit for drinks or decent cold draft beer or even beers in a bottle. A true 5 start will make you a real capaccio, not push a button on a machine and spit out a fake powdered milk coffee.
reviews.title: best vacations ever!!!!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many people have commented on the rooms and beach and I agree they are fine. The rooms are clean and relatively modern. I did notice they only gave out room key in the check in package. They do this because you need the room key to activate the electricity, A/C and fridge. So for the mini bar fridge is hot, the beer, soda drinks and water are all hot all the time. The fridge can never get cold. You can get another key for your traveling partner. My bother having a fridge in the room if it is never on.
reviews.title: Great property for Adults only

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The a la carte restaurants were a joke. The system they use is to provide you pre determined reservation tickets in the a la carte restaurants in your check in package. The tickets have a restaurant name and time. How presumptuous to think I want to eat Japanese on Friday night at 8:30!!! So in the mornings everyone is arguing with the front desk to change their reservations but alas no spots are available, but hey we have a spot in the Italian at 6. It’s the craziest system I have seen. I was in a 5 star (a real 5 star) hotel in Playa Del Carmen last summer that only had a la carte restaurants for dinner and did not take reservations. You had 5 or 6 restaurants and you showed up when you wanted to eat and sometimes you waited a few minutes.
reviews.title: 5 stars but the beach section not so good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from DR on the 19th March. This was our second time at the Grand Bahia Principe. The first was two years ago and we were at the Golden Club, this time we stayed at the Ambar. The resort is made up of the Gran Bahia Principe Punta Cana, Gran Bahia Principe Bavaro, and the newest section the Ambar (which is Adults only). This resort is huge with over 2000 suites. Although big, getting around was not difficult when using the transportation system provided by the resort.
reviews.title: Ambar Exceeds Expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Upon arriving we were dropped off on the Bavaro side and immediately taken to reception at the Ambar. After reading some negative reviews prior to going we were a little apprehensive. But from the time we got there until the time we left we were very pleased with just about everything. The staff was very friendly, courteous and helpful. There was a good variety of food at the buffet and we enjoyed the a la carte dining, particularly the Don Pablo, the Mikado and the Olivo. I am not a real fan of seafood so I really enjoyed the steak at the Don Pablo.
reviews.title: Ambar has issues!

likes.disliked: — The pool bar drinks and service.

reviews.title: what a week in paradise
reviews.text: The grounds are spectacular and well maintained. The beach is to die for with the powdered white sand which they are constantly cleaning so there is never any trash. The room was very clean and well appointed with a sitting area, a four poster king size bed, a marble bathroom with a large hydro massage tub and a separate marble walk-in shower. Although I usually enjoy taking baths we hardly used the tub as we especially enjoyed the shower facilities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went for the beach so we didn’t spend any time at the pool but if you want to exchange your blue beach towel you can do so anytime at the pool hut while going to or from the beach.
reviews.title: Great time at the Ambar
Very Nice Hotel
reviews.text: We are early risers so we went to the beach early in the morning to select our lounge chairs and reserve our place by placing our beach towels on them. Generally if you go early (before 9 AM) you will not have any problem finding a spot.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have recently come back from 2 weeks at this resort and, generally, we did have a lovely time.
reviews.title: Slightly disappointed for a 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were, along with all the others staying here who had been on the same flight as us, confused when we were first dropped off at the main reception. Apart from being told to wait there, we had no idea that we then had to go on by bus to the Ambar. Perhaps a short explanation by the member of staff greeting the new guests could be arranged?
reviews.title: One of the best vacation ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our check-in was fine but we were then left to find our own way to our villa with no real explanation of where it was situated. (Having read earlier reviews and the hotel's responses, could this please be incorporated into any future staff training.)
reviews.title: Worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were situated on the ground floor in Villa 64, which was a lovely location and one which we would highly recommend. The room itself was spacious and with a lovely king-sized bed. There was a plate of fresh fruit waiting for us, but we didn't realise it would be taken away the next morning so didn't take as much advantage of this as we would have liked to have done.We did have problems with our mini-bar being restocked properly every day that we were there. We reported this several times at the beginning of the holiday but got so fed up with the daily phone call/visit to Guest Services that we gave up in the end. I did feed this back before the end of our stay. We also found that the room wasn't being cleaned as thoroughly as we would expect from a 5 star resort, in particular the bathroom/toilet. Our cups/glasses were not replaced fresh but rinsed out each day. (We could tell as they were still damp.) As we were advised not to have any contact with the tap water, we then had to rinse them ourselves with the bottled water. There was no evidence of any supervisor checking the rooms to ensure they had been done satisfactorily. We were told by another guest that, if we had left a regular tip for the maid, we would have got a better service. I don't know if this is true or not, as we normally leave a tip at the end of our stay, which we still did this time. We did have a couple of maintenace issues but we cannot fault the response to these, they were dealt with very efficiently.
reviews.title: Very Relaxing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool area was nice, but again I don't think it was cleaned properly around the sun loungers. (We saw the same cigarette end on the floor about 3 days in a row before my husband threw it into the hedge.) The pool itself is lovely, just the right depth for us and with gentle steps providing good accessibility. Be careful when standing chatting in the pool as the fierce sun will still burn you through the water if you are in the same position for any length of time. There are plenty of sun loungers in the shade, which you will need if going soon.
reviews.title: Best ever holiday !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this resort for one week from February 27th-March5th and booked with our local travel agency thru Apple Vacations.
reviews.title: Nice Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrival: Smooth
reviews.title: Our first all inclusive and trip to DR

likes.disliked: — Lots of steps throughout the resort, hard for people with bifocals to see. Toilet seats don't fit the toilets.

reviews.title: Overbooks on purpose! - STAY AWAY!
reviews.text: After the long, direct flight from Milwaukee, we were delighted to see the open-air airport in Punta Cana. We love the very tropical-feel it offered. Everyting moved quickly---from getting our luggage to our private 30 min. transfer to the Bahia. Check-in was a breeze.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We originally booked this trip for the Punta Cana side of the Bahia. However, when we arrived at the resort we were told we were upgraded to the Ambar section. I later found out from our Apple Vacations rep. that they were overbooked in the Punta Cana/Bavaro side so they bumped us to the Ambar. It was a wonderful surprise. I guess this is another reason to book with a travel agent!!
reviews.title: A Great 4-Plus Resort

likes.disliked: — No Nightly entertainment have to travel next door

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms: Overall Impressed
reviews.title: Ambar a Good Choice

likes.liked: — Beautiful courtyard area and perfect weather.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I returned from a 2 week stay at the Ambar on 26th May and must say that although we have stayed at a lot of the Bahia Principe resorts around the world, this was the best we have visited thus far. Perhaps this was because this was the first Don Pablo (Luxury) hotel we have stayed at in the chain.
reviews.title: Excellent Holiday - Recommend the Hotel Highly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As you will read from other reviews, the Bahia Principe is a huge complex consisting of 2 very large hotels (Bavaro & Punta Cana) and on either side 2 smaller, "higher grade" hotels, the Esmeralda and Ambar.
reviews.title: Good spot to relax, everything was great minus the snackbar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ambar is an Adults only hotel and the Esmeralda is a family Hotel. I like the size of the Ambar in that it is more intimate and everything is within 5 minutes walk which is great.
reviews.title: Beware of the front desk putting you in a double-bed suite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013
reviews.text: We were in Block 65 which was dead centre of the Ambar hotel and an ideal base. I would recommend a room in the 2nd or 3rd floor as the ground floor could be quite noisy due to people walking to and from the pool area, particularly in the morning.
reviews.title: Amazing!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: All in all we had a great holiday. Food good, rooms spacious and clean, Pool and beach areas kept beautifully clean. You could tell the difference when walking along the beach when you left the Bahia Resort as immediately the beach became more littered with rubbish and seaweed which were not cleared away by other Hotels as well as the Bahia (RIU & Iberostar). one note on the beach area - great for swimming and watersports but no good for snorkelling as there are no fish to be seen.
reviews.title: Nothing comes close to Ambar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Initially I was supposed to stay in Club Premier, but when I got that that club is miles away from the beach and that we had to get a bus to go to the beach, soon I got to the decision of trying to make an upgrade to a better Club.
reviews.title: Excelent Place. Worth the upgrade from others Clubs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Club Ambar is the club in Punta Cana where you will surely rest without stress or confusion. The fact of being Adults Only is a must that improves a lot the lobby and the entire hotel environment. The location is perfect, the food is excellent, the service is wonderful. The only stress is to find a place in the beach front row. For that you will have to remove the towels that are placed in the chair at 6:00 in morning. But you if you don't mind to be in the back rows you will also have a special reserved area in the beach for the Ambar members that will have always lot´s of places available. Other thing that I did not appreciated is the swimming pool water temperature. It is so hot, that I was always missing back my home country to get a naturally fresh pool water.
reviews.title: A Canadian Perspective

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Comparing to Club Esmeralda, in the symmetric side of Grand Bahia Principe, although it is more recent, with similar accommodations, or even a bit more luxurious, it is not Adults Only, so you will be easily disturbed by children screaming and running.
reviews.title: Pleasantly Satisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In Ambar everything is "no problem" and very calm. 5 Stars!
reviews.title: 5 stars? Puuulease....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The big thing of being in the Grand Bahia Principe hotel complex is that, if you chase for night life, you find it for free even in the disco, open between 0.00 and 2.00h, with free drinks, having only the hotel Bus to catch.
reviews.title: Can't wait to go back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Casa de Campo, Paradisus Palma Royal, Majestic Colonial and now Gran Bahi Principe Ambar. As always grounds, hotel room, pool beach and water clean and beautiful and DR people wonderful. Unfortunately is rained our whole stay but because of this I realized why I go to the DR. The beach and the water are so so good that when the sun is out I don't mind damp rooms with a little smell or food that is ok( we never got sick). So if you are going for beach, swimming in their beautiful water and golf and the sun is shining you should have a wonderful time.
reviews.title: 4th trip to the DR

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most of the reviews listed do a good job describing the resort, so here are a few key takeaways from a mid 20's married couple.
reviews.title: Great Large-Scale Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things to note:
reviews.title: Amber was not perfection, but close to it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -The resort is indeed quite large, but that's not necessarily a bad thing. The beach is huge, the restaurants weren't crowded, and it didn't "feel" like there were thousands of rooms
reviews.title: Relax your on holidays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - The beach is fantastic. Soft, powdery sand, beautiful blue water. There are plenty of lounge chairs, but people do towel reserve the ones under the little thatched roof huts for shade. Also, for what it's worth, maybe 5% of the women do choose to go topless.
reviews.title: Anyone who gave this hotel one to two stars should just stay home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011
reviews.text: Just got back from 5 days at the Ambar. This was our first time in the Dom Rep, we were traveling with a group of about 20 people and was not involved with choosing the resort. Once I found out where we were going I went to tripadvisor to find out more about the resort. I was concerned after reading a few bad reviews but kept an open mind because there were just as many good reviews. So here is mine...
reviews.title: Nice resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all we (my wife and I) enjoyed our stay. We didn't have any of the problems with the resort like others had talked about. I do think we got lucky and was given a desirable room location. This resort is actually part of 3 or 4 resorts that kind of share the grounds. This place is so big they have 3 different "buses" (oversized golfcart trucklike things) to shuttle people from each end of the resort. They run all day long and we never waited more than a few minutes for the next one to come along. Had our room been over looking the route they take, I might not have been as happy about the room.
reviews.title: great time, good service, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room itself was very nice. Hot tub, separate shower, stocked fridge, flat screen tv etc...If I had any bad things to say about the room they would be the following... hair dryer didn't work, tv had problems with the picture having lines through it sometimes, room was kind of dark, and the bed was pretty firm. We never asked to have the hair dryer or tv looked at so I can't comment on that type of service. I also would liked to have had wi-fi access in the room. (As it is you have to go the main lobby to access their free wi-fi or use one of there pc's.) The buildings are very quiet and you can hear everytime a door shuts thanks to the marble floors.
reviews.title: Very "quiet" resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the service, they either really enjoy their jobs or do a great job of faking it. Again we didn't have any "problems", but everyone seemed nice and professional.
reviews.title: best ever

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The beach is very big and very busy. It seemed well kept. Just like any resort...get up early if you want the best spots.
reviews.title: Great Resort!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This resort was big, but the service was excellent bus service room service food was good staff was exceptionally friendly.We stayed from Nov 7- 14, rooms were big and kept clean we were in room 69108 witch was only a two min walk to the ocean and pool and also the buffet,which was also good.The a la carte not so good except for don Pablo's.The bartenders lino&nelson were great they work at the beach. If you get to meet tito on the beach he set us up with a great tour outside the resort for a good price.
reviews.title: Fantastic vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from our 2 week holiday at the Luxury Bahia Principe Ambar and I must say we really enjoyed the break.
reviews.title: November holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel accommodation was superb along with the food and facilities.
reviews.title: Inconsistently good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our ground floor end room with balcony was really big and comfortable with ceiling fan and aircon.
reviews.title: Bahia Principe Ambar
Nice place
reviews.text: Four poster bed was really comfortable.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at the May 19th through May 25th, let me preface, I’m very easy going and “go with the flow”, however I do like the resort to be nice.
reviews.title: Excellent stay a Bahia Principe Ambar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check In: No issues, arrived at 3:00 same as check-in. Requested block 67 corner room via
reviews.title: Good, not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: email, didn’t get a corner but did get upper floor in building 67. Near the pool.
reviews.title: Mixed Experience-Would Not Stay Here Again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room: Very spacious and clean. Bathrooms have a large shower and garden jetted tub.
reviews.title: So far BEST OVERALL IN WORLD

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We always had a Do not disturb until we went to pool/beach and our room
reviews.title: Telling It Like It Is

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were at Ambar from March 22 to the 29, 2008. We booked trhough Trip Central.ca and flew Skyservice.
reviews.title: Can't Wait to Get Back Here Again!

likes.liked: — Quality of the facilities and the FOOD
likes.disliked: — Not enough chairs at teh pool and beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I chose this place primarily because of the great reviews and traveller photos posted on this site. Boy, the pictures just don't do this place any justice. I found it very hard to capture the look and feel of Ambar through the lens of my camera. It is just so much better than any photo I took so I will just let the other traveller photos speak for me. Everything I saw on the posted photos was better in real life.
reviews.title: Ambar is Wonderful

likes.disliked: — Confusion about what was available are sister Resorts

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived earlier than the 3 pm check in time but after joking a bit with the front desk clerk, were immediately whisked up to our ggorgeous and spacious room in building 67 - the best building in my opinion. Right next to the the pool and excellent beach views. We asked for a top floor but got the 2nd. No problem.
reviews.title: Not a 5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room was huge, clean and the fridge was stocked with Pringles, Presidente beer, water, Pepsi, little bottles of Bacardi and scotch etc. YAHOOO! Our bathroom was simply A1- A huge marble walk in shower with glass door and large rainshower fawcet plus an extra massage tool. HELLO paradise. You also get a his and hers robe and slippers - nice touch. Our safe was also included in the cost of the package, nice touch and needed. The closet was huge and well appointed with hangers and lots of storage and shelving.
reviews.title: great stay
Great Resort
reviews.text: I left our maid a tip right on the first day - 10$ US and she deserved every penny of it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Feb. 2 - 9th, 2008 - As Ambar guests, we were automatically checked in & our room keys were handed to us on our bus ride there from the airport. A real bonus.
reviews.title: Beautiful Beach

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The use of the entire resort (Ambar,Bavaro,Punta Cana) was nice, but made for the entire resort feeling way to big.
reviews.title: Very Good with Potential to be Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Ambar side is definately quiet.
reviews.title: Would return in a minute!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Beaches are beautiful here. Possibly the best we've been to in the Dominican! But it is becoming more & more commercialized with every passing year. The stretches of Beach were wall to wall bodies. Makes for great people & activity watching!
reviews.title: Nice Place but a few issuses.

likes.disliked: — Hard matress and no rye included.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Food was just OK. I got a little bored with it by day 4, & I am usually a "try-it-all" kind of eater!
reviews.title: What a hassle and a let Down

likes.liked: — Good service from wait staff at the pool
likes.disliked: — Boring, bait and switch on our room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009
reviews.text: This is my first trip to DR so i don't really have anything to compare it too. But first night me n my fiance arrived with all our friends, we were placed in a double bed room, so was another couple from our group. So we called down and they told us they couldn't do anything about it till the next night. The other couple went down n complained, and they gave them a room with a king size, so we went down to complain and they told us that was not true and they didn't give a king size to anybody, which is really dumb of them to lie, we are all friends we would know. So anyhow they promised us the next night they would give us a king size, the next day we went down, same thing. Nope can't give u a king size, there's none available, so we argued for a bit, finally they put us on a list, eventually we got our room. So our new room, the safe did not work, called down about 3 times still nobody came to fix it, instead the guy starts hitting on me on the phone, i tell him i'm married n he never called back after that or showed up to fix it! The bed was horrible, it drooped in the middle, so even if u have a king size ur still rolling into the middlle of the bed. The toilet seat was missing one of the clips, so when u sat on it, it would swivel not very fun when ur drunk. Well and seeing that this hotel is 18 + up only, you would think they don't have a time u have to be quiet by, obviously lots of seniors!! we would get complaints every night, no matter which room we went too, we had 5 rooms in total. First the guard would knock on ur door, ask u to be quiet, n right after he leaves the phone would ring, n reception would say ur friends have to leave your room. were all in our mid-late twenties, i'm sure we don't need babysitters! Oh and this is the worse ever, even though u lock your room door, any hotel staff has access to enter, i remembered the one night i locked the deadbolt, the next morning we didn't hear the maid knocking, n she walked right in, we said no not right now, she left, and i locked the deadbolt again, thinking i didn't lock it the night before, another maid walked in 1 hr later. So that did not make me feel secure at all! As well every single night we went back to our room, our tv was on, it really creeped me out. I called reception saying i was not complaining, but could u ask the maid to turn off the tv when she is done watching. His reply was maybe she just wants to watch while she cleans, but i told him that was fine, just asked that she turns it off when she leaves. he just said fine i'll write a report on it. The 2nd last day we were there, we were asked to write reviews for the hotel, we had written a complaint about our safe in our room not working, and that nobody attending to it. The morning we were checking out, somebody came to fix our safe, again they had access into our room, even tho we deadbolted it. We told him don't worry about it, we are checking out. 1 hr later somebody walks into our room again wit the deadbolt locked, saying somebody called about the safe? we just told him to leave. Overall the hotel is clean, very well maintained gardens and scenery, and don't get me wrong some of the staff were very nice and polite. I think all the food was the same we had the a la carte mediterranian, & gourmet, i thought the mediterranian was the same as the buffet, but the gourmet was really yummy, i would reccomend that!
reviews.title: From reading other reviews, i think it could have been better.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here from Feb 8-15th- had a great time we were in room 66205, closest to the main lobby and only 3 buildings away from the beach- if you like walking alot this is the place- we have been to other resorts in the carribbean and this one is 6x times the size.
reviews.title: Beautiful Resort but huge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beach- what is there to complain about- absolutely beautiful- always found a place to sit, we usually went to the edge of the property there was a bar 10 ft with bathroom right behind us.
reviews.title: Be Very Careful More than just one group of travellers overbooked

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Food- was awesome- if you go hungry its your fault- never went to a buffet where they were serving caviar and it was wonderful.
reviews.title: Beautiful resort BUT very disorganized

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room- Nice size with nice balcony- always cleaned and stocked everyday- the only problem we had was getting wash clothes- but all I had to do was find the maid and would get them right away- we always tipped everyday as these ladies work very hard. Fridge was stocked usually in the afternoon- as for the beer- I would usually grab a couple glasses of presidente's and bring it to the room no big deal.
reviews.title: Awesome Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I just returned from our first vacation at the Gran Bahia Principe resort. We had emailed before arriving to request an upper floor room as close to the beach as possible as provided through our Golden Club reservation.
reviews.title: Perfecto

likes.disliked: — very large in the common areas

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We can tell you that the food, beach, ocean, pool and accomodations were just perfect. We have been to Punta Cana many many times but this was our first stay at the Gran Bahia.
reviews.title: Glad we picked the Amber.....This review more about tips !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The staff accomodated us in every way possible. From the receptionist at the Golden Club, believe her name was Milagro, to Juana our room attendant, it was so very wonderful -- from our arrival to departure.
reviews.title: fantastic vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The complex is very large and can be a maze of confusion, but by making all of our a la carte reservations for us at check-in, updrading us to the Ambar all adult section and providing easy help and transportation back and forth we felt comfortable and secure.
reviews.title: Absolutely a gorgeous property!!

likes.liked: — Close to beach, well appointed rooms, excellant food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The food was some of the best we've had and we have been to some of the finest hotel complexes in Punta Cana. The beach was large and perfectly maintained and the Rum and Presidente served without wait at the Ambar pool, beach and lobby bars wasn't bad either.
reviews.title: Super Mega Fabulous!!

likes.disliked: — Confused as to what access we had

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Date of stay 3-7-11 to 3-14-11
reviews.title: As good as it gets for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third trip to this resort within the last twelve months. We like the fact that is adults only. Checkin has always been easy and we have always got our rooms around the 3pm check in time.
reviews.title: Surprised at how much we really enjoyed this resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First time visitors should be aware that the transport drops you off at the main lobby and you need to be shuttled to the Ambar for checkin.
reviews.title: Wonderful, relaxing vacation...no complaints with resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have always had a junior suite which has a shower and whirpool tub. The room is clean and the mini bar has plenty of water and more than ample alcohol. These rooms have plenty of hot water and cool air conditioning.They were changing bath towels twice a day. Pay attention, sometimes the room safe door swings shut and it appears locked but you must put your code in every time to open or lock it.
reviews.title: Super Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For our last trip we were given 5 reservations for sit down dinners. We used the buffet 3 times and always had lobster and a good steak on the grill. We have been to dozens of resorts and this resort has the best food for an all inclusive.
reviews.title: Meet My Expectations - Fantastic Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having never gone on an all-inclusive vacation, I have nothing to base my ratings but I was pleased with everything from start to finish. I went with my husband for our honeymoon and we booked through Apple Vacations! When we arrived at the airport, which is like a large size hut, we were greeted with local singers and a had a quick picture snapped which you can purchase later. We rounded up our luggage and were mobbed by men that grab for your luggage to carry them and earn a tip. We found our Apple bus and off we went to the resort. The drive there was quite scary, they drive nuts... and it's very much a third world country. Approximately 45-1hr later we arrived and were pleasantly greeted with smiles, cold towels and cold drinks. We were told it would be about an hour before our room would be available, therefore went to the buffet to eat lunch. When we returned an hour later our room was ready and we were escorted by our personal butler, who also carried our luggage. The grounds are kept emaculate..aside from a couple stray cats roaming around occassionally. Our room was perfect, spacious and clean. We had a garden view; which was okay because a majority of the rooms are garden view; however we were steps from the pool and one of the closest villas to the beach. Don't lose your beach towel becuase, it takes one to have one. You exchange them daily and they are quite strict about losing them. Chairs were readily available by the pool but less available on the beach. Beware of nudity if you have children, there are alot of Europeans, which are not modest to say the least. The pool was very nice and the beaches are breathtaking. Seaweed was cleaned off the beach every morning. The beach bar/ and beach buffet are easily accessed and the food was pretty decent. My only complaint would be the food, it was less than par. It's very bland, with not alot of flavor. Cheese is not pasturized and spices are used very modestly, so most food tastes different. There is alot of selection of food on the buffet and dinner. Staff is very friendly and curteous; everyone always smiled and greeted us. I felt safe on the resort grounds. The shows were really great, shopping was very good, nightlife entertainment was great. We never saw children at our pool or anywhere on grounds, security guards the entrance, and everyone is identified by armbands. It was a very relaxing and pleasant vacation.We went on a snorkeling excursion and it was really good. Not many workers speak english, so there was a communication barrier. There is alot to do throughout the day as well as at night for adults. And we saw children at the other Bahia joined resorts who seemed to be enjoying themselves. I would definetly go back again, it was a wonderful place and soon I will be going to the Iberostar in Jamaica, so we will have high expectations! .. oh and the weather was B-E-A utiful!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tips :
reviews.title: Perfect!....If you're easy going!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Make dinner reservations the minute your arrive - no need to make them before you get there. We didn't and we got in everywhere!
reviews.title: beware shady practices at Gran Bahia Principe Ambar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Go on the snorkeling excursion - you swim with sharks and stingrays in a controlled enviroment
reviews.title: terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: - Walk the beach
reviews.title: pre 45th Anniversary Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Husband and I stayed at the Ambar August 22-27 & it was a great stay.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at the Ambar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012
reviews.text: Checkin was very smooth and we got a great room in building 64. I had emailed the hotel about a week prior to request this building, along with 60 & 67. I received one of the buildings that I requested which was a great spot. Very close to the beach. There was a plate of fruit in our room with balloons since we were celebrating hubby's birthday. The room was very clean and the bed was comfortable for us (we have a top of the line tempurpedic at home) with no complaints from either one of us. The sitting area is spacious along with the balcony area. You have a fridge that is stocked with soft drinks, water, and beer. Snacks are also provided (very little) with a coffee maker and very good coffee. Housekeeping cleaned our room sometimes twice a day...in the evening they would leave chocolates on our bed. This was a nice touch. We did keep the AC at the coldest temperature and it was on the warm side but it was okay. The room was completely fine for us and very clean.
reviews.title: Everything as we expected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ambience of hotel:
reviews.title: LOVED THE STAY!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since this is an adults-only resort, it was very laid back, quiet, and super relaxing. Also, great people working here made the experience even better :)
reviews.title: Great Time!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent most evenings in the lobby relaxing on the patio or in the covered areas after dinner. Very nice to just sit and feel the breeze...
reviews.title: Fabulous!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Beautiful Resort, great location, beach was fantastic. Adult only section, meant that pool area was fairly quiet for the whole week. Did not see many animation staff members for the better part of the day. If you are looking for a more active resort, this is not the one for you, definitely a place to go and relax, you do have the option of visiting other sections for a change of pace. I would not consider this resort a five star, lobby bar closes at 11:30pm nightly, the 24hr grill section leaves a lot to be desired, no decent cappucinos to be found anywhere, a 5 star resort should not be using powdered coffee and passing it off as an expresso. I have received better selection at a Cuban 4 star resort. Staff were extremely friendly, and food was great. Recommend this hotel for those who are truly looking for a place to just relax.
reviews.title: Solid Four Star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I had a very good time. THE STAFF MADE IT GREAT. They are sweet and helpful and really seem to care. The hours they keep is ridiculous though. Almost everyone we spoke to work 10 hr days minimally and work 6 days a week. Only one day off. Still, they work so hard and try so hard to please. They always smile and say HOLA to you.
reviews.title: Excellent Value for the Money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food we weren't so keen on. But it wasn't terrible ... it just wasn't all that appetizing to us. However there was lots to choose from...but some was very repitious. As for the ala carte restaurants ... Don Pablo restaurant was the best and the lobster was the best my husband ever had. Portions were small at this restaurant however ... the good thing was that you could always order more if you were hungry :)
reviews.title: Gran Bahia Principe Ambar - Outstanding Resort

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Of course it was super hot and muggy (it is the tropics after all!) but it was so hot at times I found it a bit much to take. I imagine if we had been there longer our bodies would have begun to become more accustomed to it.
reviews.title: Don't believe any body,just go.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Strange thing was that out of all the people I met, I seemed to be the one most affected by mosquitos. I was bit from my knees down a total of 58 times (I counted them the day I arrived home). It began the first night when I had around 10 of them. This wasnt the hotels fault at all ... it was something about Punta Cana and me!! Very strange. Especially since my husband did not get one bite and we did all the same things. I use no perfumes or lotions, we used the same soap and ate the same food most of the time. I met only one woman there who was getting bit like me ... and she had nowhere near as many as me. What I would say to anyone exposing their skin (legs) at night ... use deet bug spray on their legs !!! My husband always wore long pants and closed in shoes ... and I wonder if that was why he was okay.
reviews.title: Paradise, can't wait to get back there.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We have traveled to international destinations 1 to 3 times every year for the last 8 years, so I do feel qualified to offer an honest review.
reviews.title: BE careful, you do not get what you pay for!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our first trip to the Domician Republic. Our travel agent recommended 3 different choices, but we and the couple we travel with, decided to upgrade to what we thought was the finest and "adult only" resort on the goregous Barvaro beach.
reviews.title: Poor Service....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were surprised as soon as we requested the first service. A refreshment of Jack Daniels and coke after a long trip. We were told that only bar brands, not preimum brand liquors were included at this top-rated all-inclusive adult resort where we had paid an extra 30% to upgrade to the BEST. We could have the premium drinks but at $6 each upon request.. Not a good way to start the vacation.
reviews.title: Great Times and the Great Canadian Hat Exchange

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were told we could use the "sister" hotels Gran Bahia Principe Punta Cana and Barvaro anytime we wanted and would receive services the same as the ungrade at the Ambar. Put when we returned to the Ambar after visiting the two other resorts, we were charged for drinks that the Ambar considers included,but the other resort considered premium. The Ambar required us to pay for them even though we had top level arm bands.
reviews.title: It's a beauty.
Poor Experience at Bahia Principe Ambar
reviews.text: Other areas of service problems were: All BARS close at 11pm every evening, Pool closes at 6pm everyday, No food service restaurant open at all times and EVERY restaruant requires long pants for men EVERY evening (no dressy shorts). We felt like we were in the geriatric ward, everything shuts down early and NO activities.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Excellent variety of food and beautiful presentation. Felt like I was on a cruise. Enjoyed the fact that I was so close to the beach at the all adult Ambar. We were able to go to the adjacent properties to see the shows, try different a la carte restaurants . The a la carte restaurants were excellent and unlimited. Most resorts limit you to 2 or 3 only.
reviews.title: Dominican

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Sixth visit to the Ambar and would recommend everything about it. We are beach people and the adults only area is great and never a problem to get a chair. The water is crystal clear and lovely sandy beach. Usually hit the pool area late in the afternoon for a drink and no problem finding a chair and pool bar great. The food very good at the buffets (always seemed to be replenishing and cleaning and found presentation very nice also), also went to the Don Pablo (best filet ever), Italian (Portofino) --also tried the Mexican . The service was good and a very good selection overall. The room was very clean and comfortable and no issues at all. Really enjoy the bar area/lobby in the evening as some nights had very nice music/dancing. Went to the Michael Jackson show and the circus show and both were good. Check in and check out were very good as no long waits and front desk were friendly--we arrived before check in time however room was ready which was great as a lot of places you have to wait. Used the gym regularly and a bit small and crowded a few days however could go to the larger gym at the Bavaro?? if you want.
reviews.title: Ambar--excellent as always.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A great relaxing vacation at a well run resort and will definitely return.
reviews.title: 'Excelente' Vacation time - Our best overall!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We've had the luxury in spending 14 days in this wonderful resort (May 12 to 26). SERVICE is great, very nice and mature environment (gardens are so well maintained). Our Butler Emmanuel is our Best man!
reviews.title: Great Vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not to forget the other staff members who make you feel being part of their world. Room was also excellent, being on third floor, last unit before beach... could not ask for better spot. For sure, it will be a repeat vacation next year :)
reviews.title: Beautiful hotel in paradise surroundings

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed at the GBP Ambar and thought it was a great resort for the most part. We found the whole resort was neat and clean. We spent our time all across the whole resort, Ambar, Bavaro and Punta Cana sections. The grounds of the complex were huge and we did a lot of walking. So if you like a spread out, 3 storey walk up style resort this place is for you.
reviews.title: Beautiful Grounds, Great Diving, Maintence Issues

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009
reviews.text: The Beach: We loved the beach, absolutely gorgeous blue waters and the sunken ship just off shore was really neat! The sand was amazing and very clean, although there was a little bit of seaweed in the waters it was not bad at all. The beach bar was great. We were usually able to find beach chairs for our whole group of 6 pretty easily.
reviews.title: Great Time at the Ambar

likes.liked: — Location, food, beach, service, adults only
likes.disliked: — Having only 1 theatre for 5 resorts, lobby bar closing at 11pm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pools: The pools were a bit difficult as the particular color of bracelet you have determines exactly which pools you can go into. Secuirty enforces the bracelet colors at each pool and even with the Ambar package we could not use all of them. We used the Ambar pool, which was always dead, or had very few people at it. The environment was relaxing but the real action was at the main pool. The main pool area was pretty good acept for the fact that it was closed off twice during the week for upkeep from people deficating in it! Gross. So we avoided that pool after the first incident and instead went over to the Punta Cana side pool. It was right off of the Steakhouse Restaurant and had a lot of sun and was clean.
reviews.title: Great Resort but be prepared

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Drinks: We found were not bad. The inconsistency from bar to bar took a bit of getting used to. Some places were really watered down and others were strong. So we would recomend the beach bar highly! Mamajuana was plenty all over and you have to try it if you go. If I remember correctly it is a mix of Red wine, Rum, honey and tree bark. I'm sure that there we're other things in it too. It burns ALL the way down, and it's rumored to give you a "kick" in the romance department. That's all I will say about that...
reviews.title: wonderful 2 weeks

likes.liked: — Lovely spacious clean rooms with nice amenities
likes.disliked: — doors can be loud when care not taken to shut gently

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Food: The buffets were good. We only ate breakfasts at the Amber side. The buffet breakfasts were huge. They had almost anything that you could want for breakfast and the custom made omlettes were very yummy. I did find it odd that they had a lot of choclate and donuts on the breakfast buffet, but I guess to each their own. They always had western dishes at the lunch buffets and seemed to never run out of food no matter what time of day you went. We ate mostly at the buffet by the main pool for lunches. Our dinners/suppers we ate almost exclusively A la Carte. We loved the Italian restaurant, highly recomended. The Mexican place was pretty good as well although we had some communication issues since we didn't speak very good Spanish. We went twice to the Japanese places Mikado and Maiko and the cooked food was amazing. Just watch out for the sushi. Half our group got sick after eating it the second time around.
reviews.title: Fantastic will go back in a heart beat

likes.liked: — rooms were clean and modern resort well maintained location to pool and beach
likes.disliked: — doors in hotel very loud when trying to sleep you hear everyone coming and going

aka: Gran Bahia Principe Ambar Hotel Punta Cana
